Description: Fragment of offset rim and upper wall of Corinthian black-figured pottery kylix; much worn; interior: tongues between narrow bands on rim; wall reserved; exterior: frieze of stepped zigzags between bands on rim; in handle zone animal frieze, extremely worn; remains of panther to left.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see British Museum 1924,1201.1199 and 1924, 1201.1200.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.093) (Phase 1)
